Changes are needed in the presidency and the way presidents are elected. 
 
 1 Presidents should serve one 6-year term. This would reduce the number of and cost of elections. It would end talk about presidents being "lame ducks." It is redundant for elected presidents to campaign a second time. 
 
 2 Running mates need to be abolished. The losing candidate beomes the vice-president. This will bring the two parties closer and end destructive partisan politics. 
 
 3 Do away with impeachment. We have reached the point where the party not in the oval office wants to impeach the president regardless of his policies and whether they are good for the nation. 
 
 4 Eliminate the Electoral College. It serves no purpose and can cause undue controversy. The candidate with the most popular votes becomes president.
